Week 5: Results ...a finite dimensional vector space V satisfies f2=f, describ the possibilities for the Jordan normal form of f. calculate its Jordan Normal Form: ( -1 1 -2 1 1 1 3 -1 4 ). ... snippet.title: realnearJordan.html
snippet.description: * realnearJordan.html (clueweb12-0007wb-39-35175) http://math.la.asu.edu/~kawski/MAPLE/342/realnearJordan1.html ...ones above each 2 x 2 block in nontrivial real almost Jordan forms in the presence of repeated nonreal eigenvalues? Are the respective different normal forms similar? Orthogonally similar? > This worksheet calculates various similarity transformations that transform two different real normal forms into each other for matrices with repeated purely imaginary eigenvalues with nontrivial Jordan block. No theory -- just a straightfoward calculation. Next step: consider larger... [cached version]
